fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • We mistakenly referred to the Pakistan high commission as the Pakistan embassy in a picture caption about a bouquet of flowers being delivered to No 10 Downing Street (Surviving intensive care is just the beginning for patients, say experts, 8 April, page 5). • An article referred to “the Malian language Bamara”, when Bambara was meant (‘People need us’: African farmers providing fresh food for Italians, 2 April, page 27). • Other recently corrected or clarified articles include: Stranded or shunned: Europe’s migrant workers caught in no-man’s land Regulator investigates Viagogo’s £3.2bn acquisition of StubHub Donald Trump ‘lost $1bn in a month’ from coronavirus lockdown Don’t click on the traffic lights: upstart competitor challenges Google’s anti-bot tool
